thread.title: Brit Awards 2017 live: Ellie Goulding stuns on the red carpet
thread.title_full: Brit Awards 2017 live: Ellie Goulding stuns on the red carpet

author: Tristram Fane Saunders
title: Brit Awards 2017 live: Ellie Goulding stuns on the red carpet
text:
Brit Awards 2017 live: Ellie Goulding stuns on the red carpet 22 February 2017 • 5:43pm Singer/songwriter Anohni, soul artist Emeli Sandé and grime star Skepta are all nominated at this year's Brit Awards Rebecca Hawkes 22 February 2017 • 5:43pm The 2017 Brit Awards begin at 6pm tonight at the O2 Arena, London, while TV coverage begins at 7.30pm on ITV. You can also catch red carpet highlights on ITV2 between 6.30pm and 7.30pm. David Bowie is nominated posthumously for Best British Male, alongside Craig David, Skepta, Kano and Michael Kiwanuka Little Mix and Skepta are nominated in three categories each 5:43PM Ed Sheeran and James Arthur hug on the red carpet 
T here's nothing like a nice red carpet hug to kick off the night...and this embrace between Ed Sheeran and James Arthur has already set Twitter aglow. Find someone who looks at you the way ed sheeran looks at James Arthur #EdSheeranBrits pic.twitter.com/JPWMUb1sjI A sombre hat-trick for David Bowie? Credit: AFP/Getty 
A s last year's Brit ICON winner, Bowie is only the second musician to have won a posthumous Brit Award. The first was Freddie Mercury, who won Best British Single and Outstanding Contribution to Music awards in 1992. If Bowie wins in both his categories tonight, he'll break a melancholy record, with three posthumous awards to Mercury's two. Meanwhile, Leonard Cohen has also picked up a posthumous nomination in the International Solo Artist category. 5:28PM FROCKWATCH: A brace of Gouldings 
T his year's red carpet is off to a cracking start: Ellie's younger sister Jordan (left) has arrived to support the British Female Solo Artist nominee. 5:24PM Hello and welcome 
H i there! I'm Tristram Fane Saunders , and with Rebecca Hawkes I'll be your guide to this evening's Brit Awards. It looks set to be a vintage year, with a sister-to-sister faceoff between Beyonce and Solange, two posthumous nods for Bowie and a lifetime achievement gong for the ever-quotable Robbie Williams.
